what: Weight Matrix - Data is included in package weight
title: Analysis of Selection Index in Plant Breeding
text: Genetic gain Yield
code: weightMat <- weight.mat(weight) weightMat #>      ew     h2 #> [1,]  1 0.6947 #> [2,]  1 0.3244 #> [3,]  1 0.6861 #> [4,]  1 0.7097 #> [5,]  1 0.8336 #> [6,]  1 0.2201 #> [7,]  1 0.5226 GAY<- gen.advance(phen_mat = phenMat[1,1], gen_mat = genMat[1,1],                   weight_mat = weightMat[1,1]) print(GAY) #>        [,1] #> [1,] 1.7694

title: Analysis of Selection Index in Plant Breeding
text: construction selection index requires phenotypic & genotypic variance-covariance matrix well weight matrix.

title: Construction of selection indices based on number of character grouping — comb.indices
text: ncomb Number Characters/Traits group pmat Phenotypic Variance-Covariance Matrix gmat Genotypic Variance-Covariance Matrix wmat Weight Matrix wcol Weight column number incase one weights, default 1 GAY Genetic Advance comparative Character/Trait .e. Yield (Optional argument)

text: Genetic advance character character combinations

title: Genetic Advance for PRE — gen.advance
code: gmat<- gen.varcov(seldata[,3:9], seldata[,2], seldata[,1]) pmat<- phen.varcov(seldata[,3:9], seldata[,2], seldata[,1]) gen.advance(phen_mat = pmat[1,1], gen_mat = gmat[1,1], weight_mat = weight[1,2]) #>        [,1] #> [1,] 1.7694

title: selection.index 1.2.0
